snippet: Mr. Rezaian will have spent his 444th day in captivity as of Friday, the same length of time as the Americans held during the 1979-81 Iran hostage crisis.
abstract: Washington Post reports its Iran correspondent Jason Rezaian has spent almost 444 days in Iranian jail, same amount of time Americans were held during 1979-81 Iran hostage crisis; says imprisonment is ‘milestone significant in its injustice’ and asks for his release; Rezaian still awaits verdict from his closed espionage trial.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Rezaian will have spent his 444th day in captivity as of Friday, the same length of time as the Americans held during the 1979-81 Iran hostage crisis.

headline.main: Jason Rezaian, Washington Post Reporter, Nears a Grim Milestone in Iran
headline.print_headline: Middle East; Iran: Jailed Post Reporter Nears a Grim Milestone
